channel.title: Our technology experts search the planet for innovative products, and after a rigorous evaluation process, we select the best products. The result of our work is what you see here.
channel.description: Our technology experts search the planet for innovative products, and after a rigorous evaluation process, we select the best products. The result of our work is what you see here.

item.title: SYFTKOGTECH ....Information Technology and Value added Service
item.description:
SYFTKOGTECH ....Information Technology and Value added Service

We use the most current web technologies to provide your business with a forward-looking web presence. Your customers enjoy the convenience of online applications that automate your business processes, from e-commerce to online rental solutions.

item.title: PlayOn: Watch your media and streaming shows anywhere, even offline.
item.description:
PlayOn: Watch your media and streaming shows anywhere, even offline.

PlayOn lets you organize, stream and record shows & movies from Netflix, Hulu, HBO and more. Watch your media when you want on your TV, tablet or mobile device.

item.title: 10 Black Women Innovators and the Awesome Things They Brought Us
item.description:
10 Black Women Innovators and the Awesome Things They Brought Us

#BeautifulAfrica It’s Women’s History Month! We are celebrating *Black women innovators*—who are all too often overlooked and excluded from our history books. Here are awesome inventions or innovations of these ten Black women: Dr. Shirley Jackson Alice H. Parker Sarah Goode Marie Van Brittan Brown Sister Rosetta Tharpe Lyda D. Newman Bridget 'Biddy' Mason Mary Beatrice Davidson Kenner Valerie Thomas Dr. Patricia Bath

item.title: Rejoice In The Lord Always
item.description:
Rejoice In The Lord Always

Reasons to Rejoice

item.title: Mission :
item.description:
Mission :

 Jim North, Southeast Campus Editor June 1, 2015 Filed under Showcase At the time, the Oklahoma City bombing of the Murrah Federal Building in 1995 was said to have been the worst disaster in American history, with 168 deaths. However, the disaster may pale in comparison to the enormity of the 1921 Tulsa Race Riot, where hundreds and perhaps thousands died. The exact number of deaths will never be known.
